Package com.intellij.openapi.editor

Interface TextAnnotationGutterProvider

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ActiveAnnotationGutter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AnnotationFieldGutter, AnnotationGutterLineConvertorProxy, AspectAnnotationFieldGutter, ExtraFieldGutter

    public interface TextAnnotationGutterProvider
    Interface which should be implemented in order to draw custom text annotations in the editor gutter.
    See Also:
    EditorGutter.registerTextAnnotation(TextAnnotationGutterProvider)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.awt.Color getBgColor(int line, Editor editor)
      Returns the background color for the text
      ColorKey getColor(int line, Editor editor) 
      java.lang.String getLineText(int line, Editor editor)
      Returns the text which should be drawn for the line with the specified number in the specified editor.
      java.util.List<AnAction> getPopupActions(int line, Editor editor)
      enables annotation view modifications
      EditorFontType getStyle(int line, Editor editor) 
      java.lang.String getToolTip(int line, Editor editor) 
      void gutterClosed()
      Called when the annotations are removed from the editor gutter.
      default boolean useMargin()
      If true, a couple of pixels will be added at both sides of displayed text (if it's not empty), otherwise the width of annotation will be equal to the width of provided text.

    • Method Detail

      • getLineText

        java.lang.String getLineText(int line,
                             Editor editor)
        Returns the text which should be drawn for the line with the specified number in the specified editor.
        Parameters:
        line - the line for which the text is requested.
        editor - the editor in which the text will be drawn.
        Returns:
        the text to draw, or null if no text should be drawn.

      • getToolTip

        java.lang.String getToolTip(int line,
                            Editor editor)

                        Editor editor)

                  Editor editor)

      • getBgColor

        java.awt.Color getBgColor(int line,
                          Editor editor)
        Returns the background color for the text
        Parameters:
        line - the line for which the background color is requested.
        editor - the editor in which the text will be drawn.
        Returns:
        the text to draw, or null if no text should be drawn.

      • getPopupActions

        java.util.List<AnAction> getPopupActions(int line,
                                         Editor editor)
        enables annotation view modifications

      • gutterClosed

        void gutterClosed()
        Called when the annotations are removed from the editor gutter.
        See Also:
        EditorGutter.closeAllAnnotations()

      • useMargin

        default boolean useMargin()
        If true, a couple of pixels will be added at both sides of displayed text (if it's not empty), otherwise the width of annotation will be equal to the width of provided text.
